goal.ch: 這是一門專注於圖的特性與應用的嚴肅課程。我們將學習圖論中的概念與實際應用。第一個課程目標是學習圖論中可以應用在實務的數學工具與方法，並為之後離散數學或是計算機科學的深造打下基礎。第二個目標在於欣賞離散數學理論中特有的美，並以清晰的思慮寫下語言精確的證明。
goal.en: This is a serious course about properties and applications of graphs. We study graph-theoretic concepts and how they arise from practical applications. The first objective is to learn mathematical tools and methods from Graph Theory for real world problem solving and have a foundation for further study in discrete mathematics and computer science. The second objective is to appreciate and enjoy the beauty peculiar to reasoning in discrete mathematics, and to improve clarity of thought and language when writing proofs in discrete mathematics.

outline.ch:
- Basic definitions and representations of graphs
- Paths, cycles, and trails. Eulerian graphs and Euler‘s Theorem
- Vertex degrees, graphic sequences, and Havel-Hakimi Theorem
- de Bruijn graphs, tournament, and king
- Properties of trees, distance in trees and graphs
- Prufer codes, Cayley formula, Matrix Tree Theorem
- Spanning tree, Prim‘s and Kruskal‘s algorithms for finding minimum spanning tree
- Shortest path problem, Dijkstra‘s algorithm
- Matching, perfect matching, M-alternating and M-augmenting paths
- Hall‘s Theorem, systems of distinct representatives, Marriage Theorem
- Vertex cover, edge cover, independent set, Konig-Egervary Theorem, Gallai‘s Theorem
- Stable matching, Gale-Shapley Proposal Algorithm
- Matchings in general graphs, Tutte‘s Theorem, Berge-Tutte Formula and Petersen‘s Theorem
- Connectivity and edge connectivity, Whitney‘s Theorem, ear and ear decomposition
- x,y-cuts, Menger‘s Theorem and the edge version of Menger‘s Theorem, Fan Lemma
- Flows in networks, s,t-cuts, Max-flow Min-cut Theorem, Ford-Fulkerson‘s algorithm
- Planar and plane graphs, faces and their degrees, dual graphs
- Euler‘s Formula, Kuratowski‘s Theorem, outerplanar and outerplane graphs
- Graph coloring, k-critical graphs, greedy coloring, d-degenerate graphs, Brook‘s Theorem
- Hamiltonian cycle and Hamiltonian graph, Dirac‘s Theorem
- Four color Theorem
- Edge coloring, Vizing‘s Theorem
- Forbidden graph, Turan‘s Theorem
